description:
Sequel to Kuroshitsuji: Kishuku Gakkou-hen.

Ciel and his loyal butler Sebastian brave a cursed forest in Germany to uncover the truth behind eerie deaths.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

node.description:
__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

__[Website](http://coshunie.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/co_shu_nie)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/C%C3%B6-shu-Nie-%E3%82%B3%E3%82%B7%E3%83%A5%E3%83%8B%E3%82%A8-151218092226983/)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/coshunie_official/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWIfHAlwe1kELZDqUmD8oRg)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0LlH6J1tj2TPq7AlwXAkY5)__ | __[Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/jp/artist/c%C3%B6-shu-nie/573663755)__

__Formed:__ 2011, Osaka Prefecture
__Genres:__ Rock (Indie Rock, Pop Rock)

__Biography:__
Co shu Nie (stylized as Cö shu Nie) is a Japanese two-member rock band under record label Sony Music Associated Records that debuted on June 6, 2018 with the single titled "[asphyxia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZB9UvUJL_lE)". Their single was used as the opening theme in the third season of [Tokyo Ghoul:re](https://anilist.co/anime/100240/Tokyo-Ghoulre). 

Prior to their debut, however, the band initially independently released their first mini album titled _Hydra_ all the way back in 2013, and according to their vocalist Miku Nakamura, the band name "Cö shu Nie" has no literal meaning, but they instead "became the meaning of the word".

__Members:__
- [Miku Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/162259) (中村未来) - vocalist, guitarist, keyboardist, manipulator (2011–)
- Shunsuke Matsumoto (松本駿介) - bass guitarist (2011–)


__Former Members:__
- Kojiro Yamazakoo (ヤマザキコウジロウ) - drummer (2011–2017)
- Ryosuke Fujita (藤田亮介) - drummer (2018–2021)

(Source: [Wikipedia (Cö shu Nie)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%C3%B6_shu_Nie), edited)

[Official Site](https://www.hyde.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HydeOfficial_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hydeofficial) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@hyde_official) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPiJhfvRuQqQofd3xSZBQ1A)

Hideto Takarai, better known as HYDE, is a Japanese musician, vocalist, lyricist, record producer, actor and voice actor. He is best known as the vocalist for the rock band L'Arc~en~Ciel, as well as for the band Vamps. In the band L'Arc~en~Ciel he stylized his name as hyde, while in his solo projects and in the band Vamps he stylized it as HYDE. He is currently active in the band L'Arc~en~Ciel (1991–) under the name HYDE (2001–), while also a member of Vamps (2008–2017), who are currently on hiatus.
_Note: Not to be confused with [清水雄介](https://anilist.co/staff/239774)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/skm2y_1121)

Director of the Photography Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

After moving to Tokyo, Sakuma initially joined Azuhata Production, where he gained some experience before joining [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/) in 2009. There he took part in the production of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/), and later made his debut as director of photography on [Saint Onii-san](https://anilist.co/anime/15775/).
